channel.title: Hello Fellows RSPS Makers!
channel.description:
Omg, why is this not working for me. K, now what i did is i made a No-Ip. Then i went to my router which is a "Belkin" i did the whole thing with the 43954. After that i am confused, i have a SOURCE folder with the "client.java" notepad in there. and my CLIENT folder with GUI.java notepad in there. Now with my No-IP address i made, what i do. Do i add it in my SOURCE folder with the "client.java" notepad in there, OR my CLIENT folder with GUI.java notepad in there?
Anyways i hope i can get some help. And btw i have skype, which would be nice if i can add you.

item.title: Hello Fellows RSPS Makers!
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

you would compress your client into a winrar archeive then upload it and have your friend download it. He can only connect when your running your server from the source though
so you would go to your source and click Run, Run server, or what ever your source calls it then have your friend go on the client you gave him to download and he can play. Because you changed it to your ip and port so hes now connecting to you/your server

Read full topic

item.title: Hello Fellows RSPS Makers!
item.dc:creator: @xxpkpurexx xxpkpurexx
item.description:
@xxpkpurexx wrote:

hmm if i got this right you want to know why its not connecting if so im guessing you are on a 317 so

on client side open gui.java

find

Serverip =

then where it says whatever ip it is change it to yours

now go to your source and look for

server.java
then find\

connectingHost.equals

and change whatever there is after it to your ip

and your done compile

Read full topic

item.title: Hello Fellows RSPS Makers!
item.dc:creator: @deathbyu deathbyu
item.description:
@deathbyu wrote:

its 43594 for the port client and server on bot go to gui.java the search the old owners ip or search 127.0.0.1 wich is localhost and change that to yours
